title: hidaka_hokuto
body:
[[Ensemble Stars!]] character. A second year student and the leader of [[Trickstar (ensemble stars!)|]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. At school, he wears the standard [[Yumenosaki school uniform]], consisting on [[plaid pants]], a [[blazer]] and [[necktie]]. For Trickstar, he wears a [[plaid jacket]] with similar pants.

Calm, cool, and collected, Hokuto is a hard-working perfectionist. He hates when his pace is disturbed. Though he might come across as cold to his noisy classmates at first, he values his friends. He's kind and will explain things thoroughly to those who don't understand, but he's also slightly air-headed. He's very close to his grandmother and doesn't get along with his actual parents. Hokuto is also best friends with [[Akehoshi Subaru]]

He's in charge of explaining how things work at Yumenosaki to [[anzu (ensemble stars!)|Anzu]] at the beginning of the story. According to his fellow theater club member, [[Hibiki Wataru]] Hokuto stopped being "a boring person" ever since he fell in love with her. 

His voice actor is [[Maeno Tomoaki]]. His previous voice actor was [[Hosoya Yoshimasa]].

title: crooked_smile
body:
Also known as an uneven smile, a lopsided smile, and a half-smile. One side of the mouth should be at a higher point than the other.

Sometimes, but not always, used to denote cockiness or confidence. It may also come off as [[naughty_face|mischievous]] or playful. It might also denote [[nervous_smile|nervousness]].

h4. See also

* [[Doyagao]]
* [[False smile]]
* [[Smug]]
* [[Smirk]]
* [[Uneven eyes]]

title: haiyore!_nyaruko-san
body:
A 2009 light novel series written by Aisora Manta, illustrated by [[Koin]] and published by [i]GA Magazine[/i]. Also adapted into two ongoing 2011 manga in Shueisha's [i]Miracle Jump[/i] by [[Okazaki Kei]], and [i]Haiyore! Super Nyaruko-chan Time[/i] in [i]Flex Comix Blood[/i] by [[Hoshino Souichirou]], as well as two flash ONAs, [i]Haiyoru! Nyaruani[/i] (2009) and [i]Haiyoru! Nyaruani: Remember my Mr. Lovecraft[/i] (2010) by DLE, and a Spring 2012 anime adaptation by Xebec.

After being saved from a fearsome black creature, 17-year-old high school boy [[Yasaka Mahiro]] ends up with three freeloaders in his house straight out of the [[Cthulhu Mythos]]: [[nyarlathotep_(nyaruko-san)|Nyarlathotep]], the silver-haired girl who saved him, [[cthugha_(nyaruko-san)|Cthugha]], the former's crimson-haired childhood rival/friend, and [[hastur_(nyaruko-san)|Hastur]], an effeminate blond boy.

h4. Characters

* [[Yasaka Mahiro]]
* [[Nyarlathotep (Nyaruko-san)|Nyarlathotep]]
* [[Cthugha (Nyaruko-san)|Cthugha]]
* [[Hastur (Nyaruko-san)|Hastur]]

h4. Other Characters

* [[Shantak (Nyaruko-san)|Shantak-kun]]
* [[Kurei Tamao]]
* [[Luhy Distone]]

h4. See also

* [[Taiyou Iwaku Moe yo Chaos]]

h4. External links

* "Official Site":http://ga.sbcr.jp/novel/nyaruko/index.html
* "Wikipedia Entry":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haiyore!_Nyaruko-san
other_names: 這いよれ!ニャル子さん

title: danganronpa_(series)
body:
A video game and media franchise created by Spike Chunsoft. The game has often been described as a mix between [i]Ace Attorney[/i] and [i]Battle Royale[/i]. [[Komatsuzaki Rui]] is the official illustrator.

The main games are each set in a high school where students are forced to participate in a "killing game", where one student must kill another student without being caught to be allowed to leave, while the others must deduce who the killer was to prevent themselves from being executed in their place.

h4. Installments
h5. Video games
* [[Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc]]
* [[Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair]]
* [[Danganronpa Another Episode: Ultra Despair Girls]]
* [[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]]
* [[Danganronpa S: Ultimate Summer Camp]]

h5. Anime/OVA
* [[Danganronpa 3 (anime)|]]
* [[Danganronpa Gaiden: Killer Killer]]
* [[super danganronpa 2.5: komaeda nagito to sekai no hakaimono|Super Danganronpa 2.5: Nagito Komaeda and the World Destroyer]]

h5. Novels
* [[Danganronpa/Zero]]
* [[Danganronpa Togami]]
* [[Danganronpa Kirigiri]]

h5. Fan games
* [[Danganronpa Another]]
** [[Danganronpa Another: Another Despair Academy]]
** [[Super Danganronpa Another 2]]

h4. See also
* [[List of Danganronpa characters]]

h4. External Links

* "Official Site":http://www.danganronpa.com/
* "Official Twitter":https://twitter.com/dangan_official
* "Goods Blog":http://ameblo.jp/dangan-koubai/

title: tanker_(ship)
body:
A tanker (or tank ship or tankship) is a [[ship]] designed to transport or store liquids or gases in bulk. Major types include the oil tanker, the chemical tanker, and gas carrier.

h4.See also
* [[ship]]
* [[tanker car]]
* [[tank truck]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Tanker (ship)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tanker_(ship)]

body:
A ship is a large seagoing vessel, as opposed to a [[boat]] which more commonly refers to smaller vessels. 

This tag does [b]not[/b] include [[submarine]]s.

He's an [[inkling]] that does vocals and guitars for the band Wet Floor, alongside [[Ryley (splatoon)|]], [[Keaton (splatoon)|]], [[Neil (splatoon)|]] and [[Candi (splatoon)|]].

He is called Mizole in the Japanese version.

title: candi_(splatoon)
body:
A character from [[Splatoon (series)|]]. 

She's a candy crab that plays as a drummer for the band Wet Floor, alongside [[Ryley (splatoon)|]], [[Mizo (splatoon)|]], [[Neil (splatoon)|]] and [[Keaton (splatoon)|]].

She is called Kazami in the Japanese version.

title: shipping_container
body:
A shipping container (or intermodal container) is a large standardized container for shipping. Other than [[container ship]]s, it could be used across different modes of transport (from [[ship]] to [[train|rail]] to [[truck]]). They are primarily used to store and transport materials and products efficiently and securely worldwide.


h4.External links:
* "Wikipedia: Shipping container":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intermodal_container

title: overhead_line
body:
[[Cable]]s used to supply electric power directly to [[streetcar]]s and [[electric locomotive|electric]] [[train]]s.

[[Pantograph]]s attached to the vehicles are used to transfer power from the cables to the vehicle.

Not to be confused with [[power lines]], which are hung from [[utility pole]]s to transmit power from one place to another.

h4. See also

* [[power lines]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Overhead line":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overhead_line

title: the_fairly_oddparents
body:
An American animated television series created by Butch Hartman for [[Nickelodeon]]. The series follows the adventures of [[Timmy Turner]], a 10-year-old boy with two fairy godparents, [[Cosmo (fairly oddparents)|]] and [[Wanda (fairly oddparents)|]], and a wicked 16-year-old babysitter, [[Vicky (fairly oddparents)|Vicky]]. This Nicktoon premiered alongside [[Invader Zim]] in 2001, and originally ended in 2017.

h4. See also

* [[The Fairly OddParents: A New Wish]]

title: tan_(among_us)
body: A tan [[crewmate (among us)|]], [[impostor (among us)|]] or [[dead body (among us)|]]. Notable for originally being planned to be included in the [[among us|game]] before launch, only to be cut out. This fact is referenced in [i][[henry stickmin (series)|Completing the Mission]][/i]. Later on, it was finally added to the game when the expansion of lobby sizes necessitated more colors.

title: exodia_the_forbidden_one
body:
A [[duel monster]] from the original [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] series. The first (and arguably most famous) "instant win" card of the franchise, which requires the user to collect all 5 cards representing his body parts (head, both arms, and both legs) in their hand, thus requiring an immense amount of luck and/or elaborate deck build to activate its effect.

Note that this tag also covers other individual "Exodia limbs", such as Left Arm of the Forbidden One or Right Leg of the Forbidden One, etc.

h4. See also
* [[Kaiba's defeat (meme)]]
* [[Obliterate!!! (yu-gi-oh!)|]]

title: humboldt_penguin_(kemono_friends)
body: A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park. Part of [[penguins_performance_project_(kemono_friends)|Penguins Performance Project]] as "Hululu". She is typically presented as an airhead with a bottomless stomach, and is usually seen munching on a [[Japari Bun]] when idle. Hululu wears a black and white jacket patterned after a Humboldt penguin's speckled plumage, with sleeves ending in mittens as to evoke flippers. The earpieces of her headphones bear a pattern evoking the eyes of the actual penguin. As the bottom of her coat covers her lower half, she [[no_pants|appears to wear no bottoms]], though she may wear something similar to [[emperor_penguin_(kemono_friends)|Emperor Penguin]]'s leotard underneath. She has short black hair with some bangs being tipped pink; her center bangs feature two white spots. As her design bears numerous similarities to that of her bandmate [[Humboldt Penguin (Kemono Friends)]] (Hululu), the two are sometimes mixed up by taggers. While one should be conscious of artistic liberties and stylistic differences, some reliable distinguishing details to check for include: * hair length (Hululu has shoulder-length hair, Gean's extends past her ribcage) * default outfit (Gean has a ruffled skirt; Hululu doesn't wear one, and her lower half is covered by her long jacket. Additionally, Gean's jacket has a black collar with pull-cords; Hululu has a white collar with no cords.) * default headphones (Hululu's headband is obscured by her hair at the top; Gean's is fully visible. Additionally, the design on Hululu's earpiece makes a "ç" shape, where Gean's makes a fully-closed ring.) * bangs (Gean has red streaks (sometimes depicted as a red-pink) on the sides of her center bang, usually depicted from the middle to the tip. Hululu has light pink patches on the bangs flanking the top of her center bang; her center bang just has two white dots.) In 2021, a [[virtual YouTuber]] based on Hululu debuted under the franchise's [[Kemono Friends V Project|KemoV Project]] label as one of its founding members, alongside [[African Penguin (Kemono Friends)|African Penguin]]. This Humboldt Penguin is a soft-spoken and easygoing girl, generally preferring to hold chatting streams and play relaxed games such as [[Minecraft]]. A nostalgia-lover, familiar with retro music and media. h4. See also * [[Grape-kun]] * [[Humboldt penguin]] h4. External links * "Humboldt Penguin (KemoV)'s YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmYO-WfY7Tasry4D1YB4LJw * "Humboldt Penguin (KemoV)'s Twitter":https://twitter.com/Hululu_KEMOV
other_names: フンボルトペンギン(けものフレンズ)

title: gentoo_penguin_(kemono_friends)
body: A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park. She is a member of the [[penguins_performance_project_(kemono_friends)|Penguins Performance Project]] idol group as "Gean" (pronounced with the soft "G" of "Gentoo", or as in "generation"). She wears a white jacket with black along the arms, shoulders and neck, a ruffled white skirt, and yellow calf-high boots. She has rusty red-orange eyes and hair highlights, and her white headphones have red-orange rings on the outer earpiece. As her design bears numerous similarities to that of her bandmate [[Humboldt Penguin (Kemono Friends)]] (Hululu), the two are sometimes mixed up by taggers. While one should be conscious of artistic liberties and stylistic differences, some reliable distinguishing details to check for include: * hair length (Hululu has shoulder-length hair, Gean's extends past her ribcage) * default outfit (Gean has a ruffled skirt; Hululu doesn't wear one, and her lower half is covered by her long jacket. Additionally, Gean's jacket has a black collar with pull-cords; Hululu has a white collar with no cords.) * default headphones (Hululu's headband is obscured by her hair at the top; Gean's is fully visible. Additionally, the design on Hululu's earpiece makes a "ç" shape, where Gean's makes a fully-closed ring.) * bangs (Gean has red streaks (sometimes depicted as a red-pink) on the sides of her center bang, usually depicted from the middle to the tip. Hululu has light pink patches on the bangs flanking the top of her center bang; her center bang just has two white dots.)
other_names: ジェンツーペンギン(けものフレンズ)

title: mustache_stubble
body:
Short, coarse hair remaining on the upperlip after partially shaving a [[beard]] (specifically the upper lip only) or [[mustache]]. Often presents as a rugged, unshaven look, and can be a styling choice for various facial hair designs.

Do not use if the stubble is only on jaw or chin, use [[beard stubble]] instead.

h4. Examples
* !post #7211252

title: le_terrible_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the French Navy large destroyer [i]Le Terrible[/i]. Character design by [[Xiao Chichi]], voiced by [[Maeda Kaori]]. 

She has a [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[bob cut]] and [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[purple eyes]]. Her left eye is [[one eye covered|covered]] with a white flower-shaped [[eyepatch|eye patch]] and she has two black dots [[mole under eye|below her eye patch]] (that appear to be two [[mole]]s). Her default skin features a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]] with an [[white capelet]], [[blue bowtie]] and a [[center opening]] that indicate that she wears a [[bodystocking]] under her dress. It also features a [[white headwear|white]] [[kepi]], [[armored boots]] and [[gauntlets]].

Originally introduced in the [i]Skybound Oratorio[/i] original run as a story-only character, she was made playable with the rerun version.

In real life, she holds the speed record for a conventional hull ship at 45.02 knots during her speed trials (as against a designed top speed of 37 knots, compare [[Tashkent (Azur Lane)|]]'s 43 knots and [[Shimakaze (Azur Lane)|]]'s 40.9 knots, both also in trials.)

h4. Appearance

title: ikoma_minami_(kaminomi)
body: A youthful, naive middle school girl that does not seem to know what she wants to do. She is often seen alone and lost in her own pool of thoughts about the things in life. Minami loves swimming and she is in the school's Swimming Club. However, she was only able to get picked as a third substitute for the school team. When she thought about giving up the sport, like what her friends were doing, Minami was startled to see droplets of tears from her eyes. Late after school, she comes across Keima swimming in the school pool. She becomes captivated by him, describing Keima as "shining in the night sky".

title: shimanto_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the light cruiser IJN [i]Shimanto[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration. Character designed by [[Mimoza (96mimo414)|]], voiced by Hime Sawada.

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]], [[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[dragon horns]] and [[dragon tail|tail]] (a reference to her namesake river). 

Her outfit consists of a [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[Japanese clothes|Japanese]] [[kimono]] with [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves]], [[white panties]], [[white thighhighs]], and black [[platform footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] is basically a white mechanical [[dragon]] with her five 150 mm triple gun mounts.

h4. Appearance
* !post #6489503: Default
* !post #7008023: [[shimanto (the comfy dragon god) (azur lane)|The Comfy Dragon God]]

h4. Trivia
The first ship released under the sixth wave of Priority Ships, Shimanto is an anti-aircraft light cruiser based on the [i]Tone[/i]-class in design and [i]Mogami[/i]-class as her final implementation. Her design features five Type 5 150 mm triple DP mounts which can kill large wave of Aircraft alongside the Type 98 100 mm [[anti-aircraft gun|cannons]].

title: verniy_(kancolle)
body:
The post-WWII/Soviet/[[remodel_(kantai_collection)|Kai2]] form of [[Hibiki (kancolle)|Hibiki]] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She replaces the sailor shirt shared with the rest of the Akatsuki class with a [[belt|belted]] button-up sailor shirt and her hat is now white with red trimmings, with a [[hammer and sickle]] and [[star (symbol)|]] pin on it. As for her [[torpedo tubes]], she replaces her Japanese 61 cm triple mounts with Soviet 53.3 cm quad mounts on either side. Curiously, she retains her 12.7 twin gun mount Type B to her right. 

h4. Trivia

Often nicknamed "Bep" (as if the cyrillic letters "Вер" were read as Latin letters), "Beppu" ("別府", same thing but as a pun to the city of the same name) or "Nuinui" ("ヌイヌイ", like [[Shiranui (kancolle)|Shiranui]], so it's not uncommon to see the two being paired together) as her name might be difficult to pronounce for the Japanese (and most non-Russian speakers alike).

In-game, she is characterized with a lack of stock equipment (she predates [[gangut (kancolle)|Gangut]]'s appearance by 3.5 years and [[tashkent (kancolle)|Tashkent]]'s - who actually used some of the equipment that Verniy would be equipped with - by 4.5 years, and thus such equipment were unavailable in-game when Verniy came out), a relatively low luck for her sheer longevity (she was only lucky in the way she avoided combat by being in repairs), and her high resilience compared to destroyers of her size (only Suzutsuki and Tashkent exceeds her in health, both are also significantly larger than Verniy, only Shimakaze, Yukikaze and Amatsukaze exceeds her armor but none of them can equip bulges, which Verniy can).

h4. Appearance

* !post #1566678: Default
* !post #2872435: [[Verniy (Saury Festival) (kancolle)|Saury Festival]]

h4. Special Type destroyers with kai ni
h5. [b]Akatsuki-class[/b]
* [[Akatsuki Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Akatsuki]]
* [b]Verniy[/b]
other_names: ヴェールヌイ(艦隊これくしょん)

title: akatsuki_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel/kai ni of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Akatsuki (Kancolle)|]]. 

Upon kai ni, she changes attire to the standard Special Type Kai Ni uniform: a white [[serafuku]], [[black sailor collar]] with a red stripe, and [[black skirt]]. In addition, her [[flat cap]] gets the same treatment. Unlike the default Special Type Kai Ni uniform, she wears a [[pantyhose]] instead of black [[kneehighs]] with red stripe. Otherwise, her physical attributes remain unchanged from base form.

She now sports a [[searchlight]] over her left shoulder, two 12.7 cm open twin gun mounts on her right arm and a [[depth charge]] thrower attached to a [[thigh strap]] on her left. The right "shield" has also been removed.

h4. Appearance

title: murakumo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel/kai ni of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Murakumo (Kancolle)|]]. 

Upon kai ni, she ditches the sailor dress for a somewhat more elaborate white [[strapless dress]], which has vertical slits over her breasts, with a black spandex cropped t-shirt underneath. She now wears heeled [[loafers]]. Her signature [[red necktie]] is tied directly around her neck. Her [[sidelocks]] become much larger and poofier. 

Her [[rigging]] has been upgraded to be sturdier-looking. In particular, she trades her two floating 12.7 cm twin gun mounts Type B for 12.7 cm open twin gun mounts attached to her rig, one on either side. Her bridge rig on her back is also updated to match the real-life [i]Murakumo[/i]'s, but with the addition of a [[radar]] on her mast (which she never acquired in real-life). Her halo remains unchanged, but her [[rigging]] now glows blue, occasionally pink. Her mast spear is absent in her in-game portrait but other official art reveals that, while the design has otherwise barely changed as well (only the handle has moved to the middle of the shaft), it now features an actual spearhead.

title: riko_(made_in_abyss)
body:
[b]Riko[/b] (リコ) is one of the main characters of the anime and manga series [[Made in Abyss]]. She is voiced by [[Tomita Miyu]] (富田美憂).

Riko is a joyful and energetic 12-year-old orphan from the town at the edge of the Abyss, Orth. She's the daughter of the delver, [[lyza (made in abyss)|Lyza the Annihilator]]. When she was two, her mother went missing during an expedition to the bottom of the Abyss, and since her father [[Torka]] had died before she was even born, she was left under the care of the Belchero Orphanage. Riko’s dream is to become a white whistle, which is a legendary rank of cave raider, and explore the deepest depths of the Abyss to uncover its many secrets.

h4. Appearance

Riko has [[green eyes]] and [[blonde hair]], usually tied in long [[twintails]] and sometimes a [[ponytail]], depending on the situation. Her canonical attire includes a [[open_jacket|open]] [[brown jacket]] with [[short sleeves]], [[black shirt]], [[brown gloves]], [[brown headwear|brown]] [[helmet]], [[blue pants]] and [[black footwear|black]]/[[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]]. She also wears [[glasses]] due to poor eyesight.

h4. External links

* "Made in Abyss Wiki: Riko":[http://madeinabyss.wikia.com/wiki/Riko]
other_names: リコ(メイドインアビス)

title: player_character_(street_fighter_6)
body:
Encompassing tag for player-made avatars in [[Street Fighter 6]], utilizing the extensive Avatar Creator available in the game. Avatars are used in World Tour, beginning as a new member of the Buckler Training Center (with [[Luke Sullivan|Luke]] as your initial master) before going out into the world to become a World Warrior, as well as the Battle Hub, where you can interact with fellow Avatars in the same server, and enabling you to fight others using the skills acquired in World Tour.

A common promotional depiction of the player avatar is one of the "black presets":[https://youtu.be/B4qAARQdHO4?t=35]. This preset has been nicknamed "John Streetfighter/World Tour" by the fandom.

h4. Tagged Avatars

title: he_wants_to_order_(meme)
body:
A series of redraw [[meme]]s based on a photograph of a man in the passenger seat of a car leaning and crawling over the driver to order food at a [[drive-thru]] window, captioned with a Snapchat banner reading, "He wants to order."

The photo was posted to Tumblr in July 2022 and Twitter in August, inspiring numerous redraws over the following day, usually with some variation of "he/she wants to order" as the banner.

title: the_karate_kid
body:
Martial arts media franchise spanning three films, an animated series, a part sequel movie ([i]The Next Karate Kid[/i]), a streaming series continuing from the movies ([i]Cobra Kai[/i]), and a "remake" set in China.

The first three films concern Daniel LaRusso (Ralph Macchio), who learns [[karate]] from an unlikely sensei, his apartment complex's handman Mr. Miyagi (Noriyuki "Pat" Morita) after being bullied by the Cobra Kai gang whose leader is an ex-boyfriend of Daniel's love interest Ali Mills.

Known in Japan as [i]Best Kid[/i].

h4. Further reading
* "Wikipedia: [i]The Karate Kid[/i] (franchise)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Karate_Kid_(franchise)]

title: ghostbur
body:
[[Dream SMP]] character played by [[Wilbur Soot]]. He is the ghost of his living counterpart, that identifies as a different individual and rejects his former life. He is an amnesiac and is incapable of retaining negative memories.

He appears similarly to Wilbur's default skin, but with [[grey skin]] and a blue wound across his chest.

Has a pet sheep named [[Friend the Sheep|Friend]].

title: wilbur_soot_(phantom)
body:
Character played by [[Wilbur Soot]] in [[Origins SMP]], colloquially referred to as Phantombur. A humanoid based on a [[Phantom (Minecraft)|]], who is typically depicted with [[grey skin]] and bat-like wings. He has traits similar to vampires, and is incapable of going out in the sun. As such, he is often drawn in large hats or with a [[parasol]].

h4. External links

* "Origins SMP Wiki: Wilbur Soot":https://origins-smp.fandom.com/wiki/Wilbur_Soot

title: slimecicle
body:
[[Minecraft YouTube]]r and Twitch streamer who played on [[Dream SMP]] and [[Quackity SMP]] among others, and created [[Slimecicle Cinematic Universe]].

In [[Dream SMP]], he is a centuries-old slime who lacks knowledge of the human world and becomes the pupil of [[Quackity]], who wants to make him his successor in Las Nevadas.

In [[Quackity SMP]], he is a grieving and mentally unstable father who turns to destructive actions and strange coping mechanisms to try to deal with the accidental death of his daughter, [[JuanaFlippa]].

h4. Appearance
His character is a [[slime boy]] who typically disguises himself as a human man with [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]] and [[glasses]]. His disguise is usually not very good, with either him visibly being shown as dripping or melting, or small blobs of slime being stuck to him.

His default outfit consists of a [[white shirt]] with three red hearts, [[jeans]], red shoes, and a green [[sash]] fastened around his waist - a reference to his player character Br'aad in the [[Dungeons & Dragons]] podcast [[Just Roll With It]].

h4. Related characters
* [[Gegg]] - Disguised egg form from QSMP
* [[JuanaFlippa]] - Adopted daughter on QSMP
* [[SunnySideUp (quackity smp)|]] - Adopted daughter on QSMP

h4. External links
* "Dream SMP Wiki: Slimecicle":https://dreamteam.fandom.com/wiki/Slimecicle/SMP
* "QSMP Wiki: Slimecicle":https://qsmp.fandom.com/wiki/Slimecicle

title: undercut
body:
A hairstyle in which the sides or back of the head are shaved or buzzed short, while the hair on top is kept long. The long portion may be swept to one side, [[hair slicked back|slicked back]], or left to hang in front of the face.

The undercut was first popularized during the 1910s to 1940s, before becoming fashionable again in the 2010s among both men and women.

h4. Examples
* !post #7294601
* !post #2920504

h4. See also

* [[asymmetrical hair]]

* [[shaved head]]
* [[sidecut]]
* [[very short hair]]
* [[Tag group:Hair styles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Undercut (hairstyle)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Undercut_(hairstyle)]

title: aether_(genshin_impact)
body:
One of the two possible protagonists in [[Genshin Impact]] and the twin brother of [[Lumine (Genshin Impact)|]]. If chosen as the player character, he is referred to in-game by the name set by the player (as an alias/nickname) or as [b]Traveler[/b] by most people in Teyvat.

His true name is [b]Aether[/b] in English, [b]Kōng[/b] in Chinese and [b]Sora[/b] in Japanese (all three meaning 'sky'). In Teyvat, his true name is only used by his sister.

If not chosen as Player Character, he is instead the leader of the Abyss Order.

Japanese CV: [[Horie Shun]]

h4. Official art

body:
[i]Sniper Operator Pozëmka, the one who cherished Zeruertza most of all Zeruertzans.[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Avdotya Razorpen ([spoilers]born Avdotya Nikolayevna Ivanova[/spoilers])

An exiled Ursus noble and novelist who took refuge in the Durin city of Zeruertza, serving as the underground city's literature representative.

One of the main characters of the side-story [i]Ideal City: Endless Carnival[/i].

Uses a fountain pen crossbow and an automated typewriter turret in combat.

Her call sign means [i]drifting snow[/i] in Russian.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Anzai Chika]].

title: kawaii_dake_ja_nai_shikimori-san

A 2019-to-2023 manga series drawn and written by [[Maki Keigo]]. The story follows [[Izumi Yuuki (kawaii Dake Ja Nai)|]] and his relationship with his girlfriend, [[Shikimori Miyako]].

Also Known As: Kawaii dake ja Nai Onnanoko Manga
English Title: Shikimori's Not Just a Cutie

There is a Spring 2022 anime adaptation by [i]Doga Kobo[/i].

title: shikimori_miyako
body:
The titular character of [[Kawaii Dake ja nai Shikimori-san]]. She is the girlfriend of [[Izumi Yuuki (kawaii Dake Ja Nai)|]]. Her given name was not revealed until the end of the series, and only her nickname "Micchon"/"Mi-chan" had been known.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] stylized with [[bangs]] & [[hair between eyes]]. Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[black sweater]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

h4. External links

* "Shikimori's Not Just a Cutie Wiki: Miyako Shikimori":https://shikimoris-not-just-a-cutie.fandom.com/wiki/Miyako_Shikimori

title: dura_erede_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]"Dura" as in his sire's name + Italian: "Heir". This implies that he is his sire's successor.[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Duramente (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Marchesa (A half-sister of [[Satono Diamond (racehorse)|]] and sired by [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]]).

This goofball of a thoroughbred is famous for winning the 2022 Hopeful Stakes but also infamous for throwing off his jockey at a already very messy 2023 Japanese Derby, as well as managing to find himself running in the Sapporo Kinen (turf race) 2 weeks after the Elm Stakes (dirt race) in 2024. However, he seems to be the type that is strong on both Turf and Dirt.

title: hololive_fantasy
body:
The 3rd generation of [[hololive]]. Notable in that, for a long time, it was the only Japanese generation (barring [[hololive Gamers]]) with a given name.

It originally had 5 members until [[Uruha Rushia]]'s termination in February 2022.

[u]Use this tag when:[/u]

* The artist deliberately groups [b]all 5[/b] of the members (or their respective mascots) together (can also be used for the four remaining members if they are depicted together).


Do not use this tag in posts featuring all or a large portion of hololive members unless the 4 or 5 members of Hololive Fantasy are the focus of the image or are grouped together.

h4. Members
* [[Houshou Marine]]
* [[Shiranui Flare]]
* [[Shirogane Noel]]
* [[Uruha Rushia]] (terminated in February 2022)
* [[Usada Pekora]]

h4. See also

* [[List of hololive units and subgroups]]

The story revolves around [[Tom (Tom and Jerry)|]], a blue cat, and [[Jerry (Tom and Jerry)|]], an orange mouse, and their antics, which generally involve one of the two getting hurt in a neverending feud.

title: doraemon
body:
[b]Doraemon[/b] is a Japanese manga series from 1969 written and illustrated by [[fujiko f fujio (illustrated)|Fujiko F. Fujio]], which later became an anime series and later the most successful anime franchise of all time, spawned over 40 movies and a broad range of merchandises. 

The series is about a robotic cat named [[Doraemon (character)|]], who travels back in time from the 22nd century to aid a pre-teen boy [[Nobi Nobita]] and alter his family's doomed life in the future.

h4. Characters

title: gouda_takeshi
body:
Gouda Takeshi, nicknamed Gian (from the word [i]Giant[/i]), is one of the main characters of [i][[Doraemon]][/i].

Gian is a [[fat]], tall, and strong bully who harrasses most of his classmate to do or get whatever he wants. His friend is [[Honekawa Suneo]], and they both frequently bully [[Nobi Nobita]]. His antics usually cause Nobita to ask [[Doraemon (character)|Doraemon]] for gadgets to fight back. Despite that, Gian and Suneo are occasionally friends with Nobita and will not hesitate to help him when needed.

He is notorious for his terrible singing and cooking skills.

h4. See also
* [[Gian punch (meme)|]]
* [[Kirei na Gian]]

title: that's_your_girlfriend_(meme)
body:
Parody of a scene from [[Kawaii dake ja nai Shikimori-san]] presented in [[3koma]] format.

In this scene, the male protagonist [[Izumi Yuuki (kawaii Dake Ja Nai)|]] is awed by the sight of his girlfriend [[Shikimori Miyako]]'s unusually cool and serious sides (shown to tied her own hair in the first panel) during her PE class to the point that he initially doesn't recognise her, especially since she is normally quite upbeat and girly. His friend then reminds him that the "hot girl" is actually his own girlfriend.

title: dental_chair
body:
A specialized reclining [[chair]] for use in a [[dentist|dentist's]] office. Besides functioning as a chair, dental chairs often have additional features including an integrated overhead light, a faucet and spit-sink, water nozzles and suction hoses, and power for a [[dental drill]] and other tools.

h4.See also
* [[gynecology chair]]
* [[operating table]]

title: stirrups_(riding)
body:
Stirrups are ring-shaped footholds that hang by straps from each side of a [[saddle]]. They improve one's ability to mount a riding animal and stay in the saddle.

For hosiery that has stirrup-like loops across the wearer's soles but leaves the heel and toes exposed, see [[stirrup legwear]].

For the braces that support the patient's legs during a pelvic examination, see [[gynecology chair]].

h4. See also

* [[Horseback riding]]
* [[Bridle]]
* [[Reins]]
* [[Saddle]]
* [[Saddle blanket]] Cushioning, whether a blanket or pad, placed on the back under the saddle.
* [[Spurs]]

title: brave_new_world_(webtoon)
body:
Ho-Seung, an unpopular office worker who works for one of the largest corporations in Korea, is crouched over like a sinner because he was accused of setting up a camera in the women's bathroom. In the end, however, he was proven to be innocent. Then one day, he was suddenly notified of his reassignment by the team manager. It seemed that she was victorious, until...

Not to be confused with the Aldous Huxley novel of the same name.

title: yuubari_gogo
body:
A young associate of [[Ishii O-Ren]], she is a severely disturbed 17-year-old schoolgirl who delights in killing for fun. She is one of O-Ren's top assassins and is her personal bodyguard.

She wields a unique weapon, which is a heavy ball on a chain concealing spikes (a [[Ball and chain (weapon)|]]). Her attire is a school uniform, consisting of a suit coat and [[plaid skirt]].

Gogo's role is a direct reference to Kuriyama's character from the Japanese movie [[Battle Royale]], featuring Kuriyama as [[Chigusa Takako]].

h4. See also

* [[Kill Bill]]

title: majo_no_tabitabi_gakuen
body:
A spin-off light novel series of [b][[Majo no Tabitabi]][/b] written by "Shiraishi Jougi":[https://twitter.com/jojojojougi] and illustrated by [[necomi|Necomi]]. Depicted as a parody that takes place in an alternate universe where the characters live in modern Japan and study in an academy. Has a manga adaptation illustrated by various artists.

The original one-shot (English Title: [i]Academy of Wandering Witches[/i]) was later rebooted into a serialized version named [b]Majo no Tabitabi Gakuen Monogatari[/b] (English Title: [i]School Story of Wandering Witches[/i]).

Character design by [[Lpip]], voiced by [[Kusunoki Tomori]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied into [[low twintails|low]] [[twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

Her default outfit is shared with the rest of the Town-class except [[Southampton (Azur Lane)|]]: a [[maid]] outfit with matching [[maid headdress|headdress]], [[wrist cuffs]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of all four of her historical 152 mm triple mounts arranged forward and two per side.

title: ss_insignia
body:
Any form of [[Waffen-SS]] [[insignia]] that either indicate rank, "division or units.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Waffen-SS_units It came in various form, such as [[collar tabs]], ([[shoulder patch|shoulder]]) [[patch]]es, [[Reichsadler]] or [[Totenkopf]] [[hat ornament]], [[cuff title]] and [[shoulder boards]]. [[Red armband|Red]] [[armband]]s and [[Nazi party pin]]s are optional.
The most recognizable ones are the [[siegrunen|two Sieg runes]] and heraldic shield bearing specific symbol of certain division, such as crossed [[Stielhandgranate|stick grenades]] of the Dirlewanger Brigade (post #6434101).

h1. See also
* [[Black Sun (symbol)]]
* [[swastika]]
* [[Wolfsangel]]

title: black_sun_(symbol)
body:
A symbol derived from the ancient German mark of the [i]Sonnenrad[/i] or "[[Sun symbol|Sun]] wheel". It was used by the [[Waffen-SS]] in their [[building]]s and installations during [[World War II]].

The symbol's design consists of a [[circle]] with twelve radial [[siegrunen|sig runes]]. It first appeared in [[Nazi]] Germany as a design element in a castle at Wewelsburg remodeled and expanded by the head of the SS, [[Heinrich Luitpold Himmler|Heinrich Himmler]], which he intended to be a center for the SS.

h4. See also
* [[swastika]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]
* [[Totenkopf]]
* [[Wolfsangel]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Black Sun (symbol)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Sun_(symbol)]

title: hanazuki_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hanazuki[/i]. Character designed by [[Shirokitsune]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[green eyes]], [[fox ears]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[pink kimono]] with [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves]], a dark [[red hakama]] with [[hip vent]]s and a [[floral print]], [[hair flower]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]] with [[rudder footwear|rudders]] in place of the heels. Her [[rigging]] consists of two 100 mm twin gun mounts placed one to each side, 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]], her funnel to her back, and a [[parasol]]. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #3876962: Default
* !post #3876961: [[hanazuki_(morning_moon_beachside_flower)_(azur_lane)|Morning Moon, Beachside Flower]]
* !post #5089018: [[hanazuki_(blossoming_spring_resplendent_moon)_(azur_lane)|Blossoming Spring, Resplendent Moon]]

h4. History
In real life, she was built as a further simplification of the [i]Akizuki[/i]-class design to save production time, she was commissioned in late December 1944 but saw no action. She was allocated to the United States Navy as a war prize and given the hull number DD-934 before being scuttled in 1948.


h4. [i]Akizuki[/i]-class destroyers

title: royal_guard_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The Third Job of the [[Crusader (ragnarok online)|]]/[[Paladin (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Can use [[holding polearm|polearms]] like [[spear]]s and [[lance]]s or [[holding sword|swords]], but almost always have a [[holding shield|shield]]. Sometimes seen [[riding]] a [[Gryphon (ragnarok online)|]].

h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301203
* !post #7301259
Males wear a [[breastplate]] over [[chainmail]], [[pauldrons]] with the [[Cross of Prontera]], [[gauntlets]], [[faulds]], [[black pants]] under [[leg armor]], and [[armored boots]].
Females wear [[bikini armor]] with [[pauldrons]], a [[Cross of Prontera]] [[cross necklace|necklace]], [[gauntlets]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[armored boots|armored]] [[high heel boots]].


h4. [[Official Alternate Costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306151
* !post #7306153
Males wear a [[breastplate]], [[pauldrons]], a [[blue cape]], a [[brown belt]], [[faulds]], [[leg armor]], and [[armored boots]]. 
Females wear an [[armored dress]] consisting of a [[shrug (clothing)|]] and a [[pink skirt]], [[pauldrons]], [[gauntlets]], [[faulds]], and [[armored boots]].

body:
A character of the series [[Jormungand (manga)|]].

A CIA asset in [[South Africa]] assigned to work with "Scarecrow". She's more sympathetic to [[Koko Hekmatyar|Koko]] and secretly works as an informant for her.

"Schokolade" is the German word for "[[chocolate]]".

Her character is voiced by [[Koshimizu Ami]].

title: mildred_(jormungand)
body:
A character of the series [[Jormungand (manga)|]]. Also known as "Mildo".

One of Curry's bodyguards. She has an obsessive crush on [[Sofia Valmer|Valmet]], who she admires as a fellow warrior. Mildred is a [[knife]]-trained mercenary and as such, prefers using combat knives and [[machete|machetes]] as her main [[weapon]].

She is voiced by [[Tsunematsu Ayumi]].

title: aurora
body:
A natural atmospheric phenomenon that causes a pattern of colorful lights to appear in the [[night sky]].

Predominantly seen in high-latitude regions around the Arctic and Antarctic. Also known as the [b]northern lights[/b] or [b]aurora borealis[/b] in the Northern hemisphere and as the [b]southern lights[/b] or [b]aurora australis[/b] in the Southern hemisphere.

title: medic_(tf2)
body:
[i]When the patient woke up, his skeleton was missing, and the doctor was never heard from again! ...Anyway, that's how I lost my medical license.[/i]

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]], real name Dr. Ludwig.

A German man of "medicine" hailing from a lineage of mad scientists from Stuttgart, Germany (although very explicitly not a Nazi). A twisted doctor and biologist who generally considers the healing he provides an unintentional side effect of sating his own curiosity, he is known to have experimented on his teammates in bizarre, occasionally helpful ways. Despite his utter lack of morals, he provides invaluable healing for his team, and has been shown to care about them on some level, though how much of it is as his guinea pigs is debatable. Owns and cares for a number of pet [[dove]]s, chief among which is his most beloved pet, [[Archimedes (tf2)|]]. Often paired with [[Heavy (tf2)|the Heavy]], both for their gameplay synergies and in fanart.

The Medic's most important weapon is his [[medi gun]], a ramshackle tube-shaped device that projects beams of healing energy to his team. Once his medi gun has built up enough power, he can unleash the "Ubercharge", causing his patient to become fully invincible for a short period of time, shown by them becoming metallic and glowing their team's color. He also carries a [[syringe]] gun for self defense, and a [[bonesaw]] as a melee weapon. He has several alternative versions of each weapon, most notably the Crusader's Crossbow, a [[crossbow]] that fires large syringes.

The Medic's default outfit includes a large light-colored [[coat]] with buttons, team-colored rubber [[gloves]], a thick black [[belt]], black [[boots]] over team-colored pants, small round [[glasses]], and a mechanical [[backpack]] that connects to his medi gun.

Voiced by [[Robin Atkin Downes]].

title: engineer_(tf2)
body:
[i]How am I gonna stop some big, mean motherhubbard from tearing me a structurally superfluous new behind? The answer? Use a gun. And if that don't work? Use more gun.[/i]

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]], real name Dell Conagher.

An amiable, soft-spoken good ol' boy from Bee Cave, Texas, with 11 hard science PhDs and a decade of experience in the oilfields. Like his father and grandfather before him, the Engineer specializes in inventing and constructing machines and devices, from the mundane to the scientifically fantastical. Shown to be the most laid-back and friendly of the team, although his mad scientist streak comes out in the heat of combat, as shown when he willingly cut his own hand off to wield a prototype prosthetic. Odd friends with [[Pyro (tf2)|the Pyro]], and the mortal enemy of [[Spy (tf2)|the Spy]].

The Engineer supports his team by constructing three buildings: the [[sentry]] gun that automatically fires on enemies, the [[dispenser (tf2)|]] that provides health and ammunition to his allies, and the [[teleporter]] which lets them quickly travel. His [[wrench]] is used as both a melee weapon and as a means to upgrade his buildings, and he carries a [[shotgun]] and [[handgun]] for personal defense, as well as various alternatives for each. One notable alternative is the Gunslinger, a [[single_mechanical_hand|mechanical hand]] that allows him to build "mini" sentry guns.

The Engineer's default outfit includes a yellow [[hard hat]], black [[goggles]], black [[overalls]] over a team-colored shirt, a thick [[belt]] with several pouches, yellow [[knee pads]], and black [[boots]]. He also wears one yellow rubber [[gloves|glove]] that hides the Gunslinger, and often carries his buildings in a team-colored [[toolbox]] when on the field.

title: hearts_of_iron
body:
A series of grand strategy games set during [[World War II]] developed by Paradox Interactive. The games allow users to alter the course of the war via various means, from Germany winning the war to Japan joining the Allies.

The fourth entry in the series, Hearts of Iron IV, especially has been successful, due to its greater accessibility compared to its predecessor, and greater ease of modding, resulting in feature-rich mods which may even completely transform the scenario.

title: kyotoben
body: A sub-dialect of [[Kansaiben]] spoken in [[Kyoto]]. h5. Noted speakers * [[Ichimaru Gin]] ([[Bleach]]) * [[Kobayakawa Sae]] ([[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]]) * [[Shiver (Splatoon)|]] ([[Splatoon (series)|]]) * [[Kagenui Yozuru]] ([[Monogatari (series)|]]) h5. Salient features * Verb conjugations ending in はる haru * The copula どす dosu (standard Japanese です desu) * Unique negative conjugations of the verbs 来る kuru "to come" and する suru "to do": ** Kuru: きいひん kiihin (Osakaben けえへん keehen, standard Japanese こない konai) ** Suru: しいひん shiihin (Osakaben せえへん seehen, standard Japanese しない shinai) * The greetings おこしやす okoshiyasu and おいでやす oideyasu (standard Japanese いらっしゃいませ irasshaimase) h4. External references * https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kansai_dialect#Kyoto * https://japanese.stackexchange.com/questions/367/

title: kansaiben
body:
A Japanese dialect spoken in the Kansai / Kinki region in Japan.

Kansai dialect is typified by the speech of Osaka, the major city of Kansai, which is referred to specifically as Osaka-ben. It is characterized as being both more melodic and harsher by speakers of the standard language.

This accent is often translated to a southern US accent in English.

title: steve1989mreinfo
body:
Steven Thomas, known online as Steve1989MREInfo or Steve1989, is an American YouTuber and military ration commentator.

Steve began his YouTube channel in November 2015 and first gained notoriety in January 2016 for a video in which he ate 61-year-old peanut butter from a Korean War-era Meal, Ready-to-Eat (MRE). Later that year, a video review of Steve eating American Civil War-era hardtack from 1863 went viral.

Despite eating rations that are well beyond the recommended shelf life specified by Natick Laboratories and other manufacturers, Steve has reported that he rarely becomes ill, though he did contract E. coli and had to be hospitalized in 2015, ironically from a ration that was actually within its shelf life.

h4. External Links
* "YouTube: Steve1989MREInfo":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2I6Et1JkidnnbWgJFiMeHA]

title: dreyse_needle_gun
body:
The [b]Dreyse needle gun[/b] is an single-shot [[bolt action]], breech-loading [[rifle]] that was invented by Johann Nikolaus von Dreyse. It is famous for being the first bolt-action rifle that has been fielded by an national military, and serve as the design basis of all future bolt-action rifles that surpassed it. It entered in service as the main infantry weapons of the [[Prussia]]n Army in 1841, toward the unification of the [[German Empire]] in 1871. After the unification, it was replaced by an improved version of it as the [b]Mauser Model 1871[/b], which further improvement of the design has led to the rise of the the Mauser [[gun|rifle]] family, which its latest version is the [[Mauser 98]].

Its military designation as the "ignition needle rifle" (German: Zündnadelgewehr) was based on its firing pin, since it passed like a needle through the paper  [[cartridge]] to strike a percussion cap at the base of the bullet.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dreyse needle gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dreyse_needle_gun
* "Wikipedia: needle gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/needle_gun

title: kyuudou
body:
Traditional Japanese [[archery]] is called Kyuudou (弓道). The [[bow_(weapon)|]], called a [[yumi (bow)|]], is constructed in a very special way such that it can be easily used while riding on a horse. This is done by modifying the design of the bow itself such that the main point of recurve on the bow is below its center.  

The bow itself will be quite long, yet the arrow is still fired in the same manner as the English long bow; its main difference being the lower firing position and the bow usually extend several feet above the archer's head.

Women are frequently seen wearing a breastplate while practicing; this is a [[muneate]]. Its purpose is to protect the breasts from the snap of the bow string when it is fired.

h4. Examples

* !post #6527902

h4. See also

* [[muneate]]

title: hibiscus
body:
A flowering plant in the [i]Malvaceae[/i] family. Arguably the most popular tropical flower.

Commonly represented by [i]Hibiscus rosa-sinensis[/i], also known as [b]Chinese hibiscus[/b] and [b]Hawaiian hibiscus[/b]. It has five wide petals and a prominent long pistil covered with stamens near the tip. Common colors include pink, red, orange, yellow, shades of purple and white.

Makes the perfect accessory as a [[hair flower]] for a [[bikini]]/[[swimsuit]].

title: flintlock
body:
An Old World firearm that used the flintlock mechanism to propel bullets. A mechanism where a hammer holding flint strikes a piece of steel and produces sparks. The sparks fall into a pan of gunpowder and ignites the powder. A small hole from the pan to the barrel allows flame to travel and ignite the powder in the barrel. Replaced the matchlock and wheellock. This mechanism was eventually replaced by the more reliable cap-and-ball percussion system.

title: crt
body:
A CRT (cathode-ray tube) is a display technology used in [[television]]s and computer [[monitor]]s, before LCDs and plasma displays replaced them. Characteristically fat and boxy.

While abandoned by most consumers for being much more heavy and large than other types of displays at comparable screen sizes, CRTs are still appreciated by some enthusiasts and professionals for their superior color reproduction, lack of input lag, and lack of native resolution.

h4. Examples

* !post #2918632: CRT [[television]]
* !post #5293314: CRT [[monitor]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Cathode-ray tube":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cathode_ray_tube]

title: blunderbuss
body:
A [b]blunderbuss[/b] is a [[firelock]] muzzle-loading [[gun|firearm]] with a short, large caliber barrel, which is flared at the muzzle and frequently throughout the entire bore.  this allows the weapon spread all the projectiles to any directions, from its flared muzzle, A blunderbuss can fire round lead pellets and any smaller projectiles of relevant quantity and/or caliber. It's essentially a one-shot muzzle-loaded [[shotgun]], during the 17th century to the 18th century.

h4. See also

* [[list_of_weapons]]
* [[Flintlock]]
* [[Musket]]

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia: Blunderbuss":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blunderbuss

title: purikura
body:
Short for "Print Club", Purikura is a term for machines that take pictures of people's faces or figures and print them onto stickers. On the Pixiv platform, it also refers to a tag for artworks designed to resemble these stickers.

It was invented by ATLUS, and "Purikura" and "Print Club" are now registered trademarks of Sega, but the term "Purikura" is colloquially used to refer to similar products from other companies as well.

body:

title: indonesian_high_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by [[Indonesia]]n high school students.

The female uniform consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[blue necktie|light blue]]/[[grey necktie]] and a [[blue skirt|light blue]]/[[grey skirt]]. The male uniform consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[blue necktie|light blue]]/[[grey necktie]] and a [[blue pants|light blue]]/[[grey pants]]. There is a distinct "OSIS" logo on the shirt's left [[pocket]] for both genders.

title: kong_(monsterverse)
body:
[[King Kong]] as he appeared in [[MonsterVerse]] series. Referred simply as "Kong" within the series.

Compared to his original version, Kong is significantly larger, standing at over 109 meters tall, making him qualify as a [[kaiju|kaiju]]. He is also noticeably intelligent enough to communicate with humans to some extent.

In [[Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire]], Kong received a [[power fist]] from Monarch (the kaiju monitoring organization) to help the humanity keep other kaijus in check.

title: american_psycho
body:
A black comedy-horror novel by [[united_states|American]] writer Bret Easton Ellis, published in 1991. It was adapted into a 2000 film directed by Mary Harron and starring [[Christian Bale]] in one of his pre-[[Batman Begins]] roles.

It is a satirical psychological thriller that delves into the dark and disturbing mind of [[Patrick Bateman]]. The story is set in the 1980s during the height of the yuppie culture in [[new york city|New York City]]. It follows the perspective of Patrick Bateman, a wealthy investment banker, as he navigates his high-powered job, materialistic lifestyle, and his double life where he engages in supposed acts of extreme violence, murder and sadism. 

The novel is known for its graphic and explicit descriptions of violence, consumerism, and the shallow nature of 1980s society. It has sparked controversy and debate since its release and has been adapted into a film in 2000.

The film was considered a box-office disappointment but has since developed a large cult following. The film experienced a revival of popular interest in the 2020s due to its strong presence in contemporary meme culture, typically centered around Bateman's perceived "sigma" personality. 

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: American Psycho":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho]
* "Wikipedia: American Psycho (film)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho_(film)]

h4. See Also

title: destoroyah
body:
A draconic [[kaiju]] from the [[Godzilla (series)|]] series, first appeared in [[Godzilla vs. Destoroyah]].

Originally a primordial microscopic organism born 2.5 billions years ago during the Precambrian period, where earth is still lacking in oxygen. Destroyah was awakened from stasis after the usage of [[Oxygen Destroyer]] bomb against the original [[Godzilla]] in 1954. After being exposed to enriched oxygen due to excavation work, Destroyah rapidly evolved to massive size.

title: homework
body:
Assignments that [[teacher]]s give to students to finish at home. These can be short-term questions or long-term projects, but both are due by a certain deadline.

For Japanese students, one of the noteworthy homework is that in the summer vacation. They take this long vacation in the middle of the Japanese school year (starting in April), so teachers give them some amount of homework. You should work on it little by little, or you end up with the homework hell in the end of the vacation.

h4. See also

title: orc
body:
A [[monster|monstrous]] humanoid creature, semi-intelligent and usually aggressive. Very prevalent in fantasy universe stories and video games.

Their appearance varies (even more so if they are half-orcs), but usually they have a [[muscular]] or [[fat]] build, [[green skin|green]] or [[grey skin]], large [[tusks]], and [[pointy ears]]. [[Female orc]]s are often depicted as [[tall female|tall]], [[muscular female|muscular]], and voluptuous with [[large breasts]]. In Japanese fantasy art, male orcs are often also given [[pig|piglike]] [[snout]]s, pig/wild [[boar]] head or simply [[pig ears]].

Orcs are usually depicted as an arch-enemy to [[elf|Elves]], and are very frequently paired with them in NSFW works.

h4. See also

* [[female orc]]
* [[ork (warhammer)|]] (this tag is used for orcs in [[Warhammer 40k]])
* [[ogre]]
* [[oni]]
* [[troll]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: hatsuharu_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)
body:
The kai/retrofit form of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Hatsuharu (Azur Lane)|]]. 

Upon retrofit, she casts aside her grey sweater to reveal a [[sleeveless]] [[midriff]] white top with a [[white sailor collar]], while her skirt turns [[white skirt|white]] with a [[side slit]]. She also gains white [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[long sleeves]] with a "mountain stripe pattern" reminiscent of the Shinsengumi, with the colors inverted.
Her rig is also larger and more mechanical, attached on the waistline, carrying two 12.7 mm twin gun mounts and a single 61 cm triple torpedo mount. Also attached to the rig is a [[katana]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #3729047

title: kasshoku_musume_no_latina-san_ni_ore_no_karada_ga_nerawarete_iru
body:
A light novel by Kiraku Kishima, with illustrations by [[Oryo (oryo04)|]].

The announcement of the light novel went viral on Twitter after being shared by Manga Mogura, with the title [i]"The Dark Brown Latina Girl Is Aiming For My Body"[/i], initially due to the absurdity of the scenario. 

The initial "title" was later revealed to be mistranslated, with the title indicating that the main female protagonist was called "[[latina olavomiwa|Latina]]" (ラティーナさん as opposed to ラテン系). The illustrator affirmed she was called "Latina", and later the author revealed that she was an indigenous Amazonian from Brazil, and that her name was a result of him asking AI for "the most typical South American female names".
other_names: 褐色娘のラティーナさんに俺の体が狙われている

title: tensei_shitara_slime_datta_ken
body: That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime (Japanese: 転生したらスライムだった件, Hepburn: Tensei Shitara Suraimu Datta Ken) also known as TenSura (転スラ) or Slime Isekai is a Japanese fantasy light novel series written by Fuse, and illustrated by Mitz Vah about a salaryman who is murdered and reincarnates in a sword and sorcery world as a slime with unique powers and gathers allies to build his own nation of monsters.

Having grown up idolizing [[Bay (Nikke)|]], Clay relentlessly strives to achieve her dreams.

title: bay_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. Captain of [[Rewind (nikke)|]], the Ark's cheerleading squad, consisting of her and [[Clay (Nikke)|]].

Suffers from scopophobia, but becomes very enthusiastic when it comes to cheering someone on.

Captain of the cheerleading squad Rewind. When she gets in the zone and cheers someone on, no one can motivate like she can.
Bay's dream is for her spirited cheers to touch every corner of the Ark.

title: naoi_ayato

An [[Angel Beats!]] character. He has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. He is the Vice President of the Student Council, and is normally seen wearing a black [[gakuran]], black [[pants]], and a [[black hat]]. 

Voiced by [[Ogata Megumi]].

title: cast_away
body:
Cast Away is a 2000 American survival drama film directed and co-produced by Robert Zemeckis and starring [[Tom Hanks]], Helen Hunt, and Nick Searcy. The film depicts a FedEx employee stranded on an uninhabited island after his plane crashes in the South Pacific and his desperate attempts to survive on the island using remnants of his plane's cargo. 

h4.External Links
* "Wikipedia: Cast Away":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cast_Away

title: balan_wonderworld
body:
A platforming video game developed by Arzest and Balan Company, published by [[Square Enix]], and released for [[PlayStation 4]], [[PlayStation 5]], [[Xbox One]], [[Xbox Series X]], [[Nintendo Switch]], and [[computer|PC]] on March 26, 2021.

Despite seemingly having a dream team behind the game with [[Sonic (series)|]] creator Naka Yuji helming the project as director, [[Ooshima Naoto]] providing original character designs, and Square Enix's trademark CGI cutscene quality, the game was largely criticized upon release due to it's questionably simple gameplay, useless powerups, and subpar level design.

title: candy_apple
body:
Also known as [b]Toffee apple[/b], in Commonwealth English.

A whole [[apple]] covered in a hard sugar candy coating, [[caramel]], or [[chocolate]]. Candy apples are a common treat at [[autumn]] [[festival]]s such as [[Halloween]].

It is easy to mistake a candy apple for a red [[lollipop]] due to artists drawing a candy apple spherical. So take notice of the surroundings, flat bottom/top and size of the candy.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22761715

h4. See also

* [[Tanghulu]], Chinese candied fruit stick.
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: luna_(arcaea)
body:
A side story Partner in [[Arcaea]]. Twin sister of [[eto_(arcaea)|Eto]].

Luna is described in the game as a merciless girl. She also does not feel friendly and affable to other people as well, while daring people to play her challenge, Singularity.

She is much more affectionate towards her twin sister, Eto, however, as shown in their side story.

title: ein_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]].

A very young girl with pure [[white skin]], [[orange eyes]] with [[x-shaped pupils]], with an [[extra pupils|extra pupil]] in one of her eyes, [[white hair|white]], [[medium hair|shoulder length]] hair styled into [[twintails]].

She usually wears a [[white coat|white]] [[bottomless]] [[open coat|open]] [[off-shoulder coat|off-shoulder]] [[coat]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]] that could reach [[sleeves past wrists|past her wrists]]. Other notable features include her black, [[mechanical tail]], [[respirator]] and [[mechanical hands]].

Often seen together with [[Ohr (Blue Archive)|]] and [[Sof (Blue Archive)|]].

title: emoji
body:
Emoji are Unicode characters designed to represent pictograms and [[emoticon|emoticons]]. The term itself, however, is most often used to refer to the pictograms and emoticons themselves. The word "Emoji" comes from the Japanese word "絵" ([i]e[/i], "picture") + "文字" ([i]moji[/i], "character"). Its resemblance to the word "emoticon" is purely coincidental.

Emoji as we know them originated as a proprietary system by a Japanese mobile phone operator [[NTT DoCoMo]] using a Unicode private-use block to encode their emoticons. While other mobile providers used many other systems for emoji, this system was the most compact implementation used at the time (and the closest to the current one).

The very first Emoji were actually Unicode Dingbats, of which, quite a few are now official Emoji. Emoji became a standardized system with its implementation in Unicode 6.0 in 2010 but it's only around 2014-2015 that their use exploded and became commonplace to the point that they became a cultural phenomenon with real world merchandise and even a movie about them.

h4. List of emoji

* 😈 [[demon emoji]]

title: morse_code_commentary
body:
A [[commentary]] written in [[morse code]].

It is recommended to decode (translate) the code into English, as there are different types of text encoding.

title: cyrillic_commentary
body:
A [[commentary]] written in [[Cyrillic]]. Not recommended due to redundancy and impossibility of unambiguous definition.

Use this tag only when it is either impossible to unambiguously determine the language (comments from one character or several unrelated characters, or as part of other languages), or when the Cyrillic in question is used for a non-Cyrillic-using language.

Otherwise, put only the language tag, such as:

* [[Russian commentary]]
* [[Serbo-Croatian commentary]]
* [[Ukrainian commentary]]

h4. See also

* [[symbol-only commentary]]
* [[mixed-language commentary]]

title: yankumi_covering_for_her_student_who_faps_to_blue_archive_(meme)
body:
Japanese copypasta meme featuring [[Gokusen]] character [[Yamaguchi Kumiko]] (nicknamed Yankumi) verbally defending one of her students who masturbates to [[Blue Archive]] girls. First surfaced in July 2022 and soon spread like wildfire to various Japanese image boards and social media. Then people started uploading animated music videos on Nico and Youtube.

Note that this is not canon, but a fanon meme.

h4. Original copypasta

Original JP:

[quote]待たせたな。

お前ら笑うなっ！

こいつは
誰も知らねぇとこで、

毎日ブルーアーカイブで
過酷なオナニー
してんだよっ！

お前らは毎日
ブルーアーカイブで
オナニーして、

精子出してんのか？

出してねぇやつは

笑うなっ！[/quote]

Translation:

[quote]

Kept you waiting, huh.

DON'T YOU GUYS DARE LAUGH!

He's been fapping away real hard in secret to [[Blue Archive|Blue Archive]] every day!

Do you guys even fap to Blue Archive every day and cum?

If you don't then DON'T LAUGH!

[/quote]

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: ブルアカで抜いた生徒を庇うヤンクミ":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%83%96%E3%83%AB%E3%82%A2%E3%82%AB%E3%81%A7%E6%8A%9C%E3%81%84%E3%81%9F%E7%94%9F%E5%BE%92%E3%82%92%E5%BA%87%E3%81%86%E3%83%A4%E3%83%B3%E3%82%AF%E3%83%9F]
* "Youtube: [音MAD] ブルアカで抜いた生徒を庇うアルティメットセンセイ [コメント付き]":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BqDKIuCkEQs]

title: kitagawa_yuusuke
body:
[[Persona 5]] character. Voiced by [[Sugita Tomokazu]] (JP) / [[Matthew Mercer]] (EN).

A second year student at Kosei High School, with a unique artistic talent and the star pupil of [[Madarame Ichiryuusai|a famed Japanese-style artist]]. He is particularly focused on his artistry, often to the detriment of his own well-being. His initial Persona is [[Goemon (Persona 5)|]].

title: kalashnikov_rifle
body:
Any type of self-loading [[rifle]] based on Mikhail Kalashnikov's [[AK-47]] design. This includes license-manufactured variants outside of Russia as well. Please use this tag for any unidentified AK of unknown type. 

Please do not use for:

* Similar-looking rifles with different design (e.g. [[AN-94]], [[AS Val]], [[Dragunov SVD]] and [[Vz. 58]]).
* Rifles that copy the AK design but were not officially licensed (e.g. Finnish [[Rk62]], Israeli [[imi galil|Galil]] and [[Galil ACE]]).

title: koi_koi_cafe_(ensemble_stars!)
body:
An event story in [[Ensemble Stars!]], released on Jan 30th 2024. It's 6 chapters long and features [[Shino Hajime|Hajime]], [[Himemiya Tori|Tori]], [[Tenshouin Eichi|Eichi]] and [[Shiina Niki|Niki]].

[quote][i]"Niki makes some highly-nutritious cookies that contain a rare plant for Tori. 
Tori immediately has Eichi eat them — however, the plant has the ability to make those who eat it "fall in love"…"[/i][/quote]

For characters that have this event's outfit as an [[official alternate costume|canon alternate outfit]], see one of the following:

* [[Himemiya Tori (Koikoi Love Cafe)]]
* [[Shiina Niki (Koikoi Love Cafe)]]
* [[Tenshouin Eichi (Koikoi Love Cafe)]]
* [[Shino Hajime (Koikoi Love Cafe)]]

This tag also encompasses characters [[cosplay|cosplaying]] the clothing in this event as an [[alternate costume]], as well as canon and non-canon depictions of the event.

title: tiananmen_square_copypasta
body:
A [[meme]] copypasta containing various known blacklisted words of the of the [[china|Chinese]] internet censorship algorithm. The original intent of the copypasta is to cause any internet user from mainland China to get blocked after the censorship algorithm detects such keywords.

A Chinese equivalent of the copypasta existed in the form of the Zhao Bomb Magnet (赵弹磁铁), a text generator which could implicate whomever you were talking to of supporting things the government opposed, in the ultimate hope of getting the other user to delete their account to avoid being associated with it. The Zhao Bomb Magnet existed for slightly over a year before it got taken down, with its creator going dark at around the same time.

h4. Full copypasta

[quote]

title: mizu_happi
body:
A mizu [[happi]] is a type of [[Japanese clothes]] worn during a [[Shinto]] [[festival]] by those carrying the yamakasa, a type of float. It consists of a [[fundoshi]] and a small cloth jacket tied together from the front with a knot. Due to the revealing nature of the clothes, men are the ones to wear them, though women are often drawn wearing them for fanservice reasons.

h4. Examples

* !post #2115116
* !asset #14315859

title: zero_suit
body:
A blue [[bodysuit]] worn by [[Samus Aran]] in the [[Metroid]] series.

The suit first appeared in [[Metroid: Zero Mission]], but later appeared in many other games. The suit's appearance differs slightly between games. In [[Metroid: Zero Mission]], the suit has black highlights on the legs. In [[Metroid: Other M]], the suit has dark blue highlights. In [[Super Smash Bros.]], the suit has glowing yellow [[high heels]].

h4. Examples

title: cable_knit
body:
A knitting style that features textured three dimensional overlapping layers that usually either look like a braided cable or rope, a lattice of repeating Xs, a chain, or other similar interlocking pattern.

[[Aran sweater]]s prominently feature this knit style, to the point that almost the entire sweater is comprised of various types of cable knitting. The [[virgin killer sweater]] also usually features cable knitting.

h4. Examples

* !post #3345233: Cable knit [[Aran sweater]]
* !post #2962620: A sweater that is both [[ribbed sweater|ribbed]] and cable knit
* !post #3415232: A lattice cable knit
* !post #3463461: Cable knit hat
* !post #2532992: Cable knit mittens
* !post #2507157: Cable knit hat, mittens, and scarf

h4. See also

* [[sweater]]
* [[aran sweater]]
* [[virgin killer sweater]]
* [[ribbed sweater]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Cable knitting":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cable_knitting]

body: A 2017 television series airing on FX. Based in the [[X-Men]] [[x-men film series|continuity]], it follows David Haller, also known as Legion, a powerful mutant with schizophrenia.

title: nightgown
body:
A nightgown, nightie or nightdress is a loosely hanging item of nightwear, today almost exclusively worn by women.

A nightgown may have any neckline, and may have sleeves of any type, or be sleeveless, and any shoulder strap or back style. The length of a nightgown may vary from hip-length to floor-length. A short nightgown can be called a "shortie" or a [[Babydoll]].

h4. Examples

* !post #3820402
* !post #3825422

* [[Babydoll]]

title: outfit_connection
body:
[[Crossover]] or [[cosplay]] of characters who share similar outfit designs, styles or themes.

This tag applies best on characters from different series but can be used for character from the same series as long as the designs aren't intentionally made similar for [[uniform]] or [[matching outfits]] purposes.

For design connections based on a specific accessory, use [[accessory connection]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #3891011: "X" on the chest

title: chest_sarashi
body:
A [[sarashi]] worn around the chest area. This sarashi style is typically worn in the style of a [[tube top]], in which the bandages wrap around only the chest area in a very nontraditional way while leaving the [[midriff]] bare. This sarashi style is especially seen on kendo girls and other fighters and is a more common form of sarashis worn by female characters in anime and video games.

title: enna_alouette_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Enna Alouette]]. 

It consists of a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress|white]], [[purple dress|purple]] [[multicolored dress|and]] [[blue dress|blue dress]] with a pair of [[white pantyhose|white]] [[pantyhose]] and a pair of [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]] on (sometimes she streams with her [[bare legs|bare legs]] and [[barefoot|feet]].) She also wears [[aqua nails|aqua]] [[nail polish|nails]] on.

From her full costume, she also wears a [[white hood]] with a [[black bowtie|black]] and [[green bowtie]], extended [[detached sleeves|detached]], [[long sleeves|long sleeves]] with [[bridal gauntlets|bridal gauntlets]] and [[fur bracelet|fur bracelets]]. She wears a [[blue bag|blue]] [[handbag]] and a number of [[purple bow|purple]] and [[blue bow|blue]] [[bow|bows]] on her dress, although she does not wear these clothes and ornaments often on her streams.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4832540: Profile (complete)
* !post #4836709: Reference sheet (1)
* !post #4836710: Reference sheet (2)
* !post #4836711: Reference sheet (3)

body:
The default/first [[school uniform]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Higuchi Kaede]].

Her first school uniform, the "[[winter uniform]]", consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[purple necktie]], [[brown vest]], black [[blazer]], [[black skirt|black]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white socks|white kneehighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. In April 2022, she received an "update":[https://twitter.com/HiguchiKaede/status/1512800080549408769] that allowed her to remove the uniform's blazer, emphasized by her shirt, vest and necktie being loosened, along with a new [[necklace]].

body:
The default costume of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Finana Ryugu]].

Her default costume consists of a [[frilled sailor collar]] [[green dress]], [[wrist cuffs]], [[bike shorts]], and a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[showgirl skirt]], with an ornamental belt comprised of [[seashell]]s and [[starfish]] and a pair of [[green footwear|green]] [[multicolored footwear|and]] [[white footwear|white]] [[high heels]]. Her costume has a [[navel]] [[navel cutout|cutout]], and she has tattoo-like scale-shaped markings on her [[neck tattoo|neck]] and [[leg tattoo|legs]]. She often wears [[green nails|green]] [[nail polish]].

title: barbell_piercing
body:
A type of [[piercing]] jewelry that is composed of a straight bar and with a bead on each end.

One or both beads are unscrewable for removal and/or changing of the beads. Often one of the beads is fixed, either via epoxy or welding, so that only one bead is used to install or remove the jewelry. 

There are also variations of the barbell piercing. Most common are [i]curved barbells[/i] (mostly used for [[navel piercing|navel piercings]]), [i]circular barbells[/i] and [i]surface bars[/i] which are used in surface piercings.

h4. Examples

* !post #6270463: [[Industrial piercing]]
* !post #7819589: [[Tongue piercing]]
* !post #4746679: [[Navel piercing]]

h4. See also

* [[captive bead ring]]
* [[nipple bar]]
* [[piercing]]
* [[Tag group:Piercings]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Barbell (piercing)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbell_(piercing)]

title: hakama
body:
Traditional [[Japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]], looking like either a [[pleated skirt]] ([[hakama skirt]]) or baggy, pleated [[pants]] ([[hakama pants]]). A traditional hakama has seven deep pleats, five in the front and two in the rear.

Hakama are split into a front and back section at the top, each of which have ties which are secured around the waist, often with visible [[hip vent]]s and usually covering the midriff. Hakama are worn over a [[kimono]].

Commonly worn both by [[samurai]], [[miko]] and [[kannushi]], practitioners of many martial arts including [[kyuudou]], and often by [[sumo]] wrestlers when appearing in public outside the ring.

Traditionally worn by men with either a [[kataginu]] sleeveless jacket/vest in an outfit known as [i]kamishimo[/i] (lit. upper & lower) or over a formal, long-sleeved [i]montsuki[/i] [[kimono]], with the family crest on it.  Sometimes a [[haori]] is worn over the latter.

Hakama are also commonly worn by both female college students and female teachers or professors at graduation ceremonies because during the late 19th and early 20th centuries they were the standard female school uniform until the introduction of the [[serafuku]]. Also during this time period they were a fashionable day to day outfit for young women, often paired with a kimono with a simple geometric or floral print. Women's hakama tend to be either solid color or with a graduated hue, and hakama meant for young women may be sparsely decorated with floral decorations, they are paired with a solid color kimono.

This Omori is still named similarly to his counterpart in the later appearing videogame, but he's implied to be older than thirteen and seems to be living in an abstracted version of reality unlike the dream world Game Omori resides in. title: tokino_sora_(old_design)
body:
The old designs of [[hololive]]'s [[Tokino Sora]]. This tag is for all her pre-2018 base appearances, and all of her various outfits before June 2019.

Since her debut in September 2017, she has had several iterations of her base design and 3D model, each including their own outfits and accessories. Counting changes to her default appearance, until her updated base model was revealed in June 27, 2019, she had a staggering [i][b]13[/b][/i] outfits! They were, in order, her September 2017 debut model, her October 2017 updated model, her 2017 Halloween outfit, her 2017 Christmas outfit, her 2018 New Years outfit, her quiz show outfit from January 2018, her 2018 Valentine's outfit, her 2018 base model outfit (which established the base of her current default), a red outfit from June 2018, her 2018 Halloween outfit, her 2018 Christmas outfit, her 2019 New Years outfit, and her 2019 Valentine's outfit.

title: tenkai_tsukasa
body:
An independent [[Virtual YouTuber]] and leader of the group [[BANs]]. His initial design was created by [[Magura Ene]], while his current illustrator is [[K-SUWABE]]. 

He started his activities on June 2, 2018 soon after [[Bitou Kaiji]] ceased activities. Since then, he has frequently collaborated with various VTuber groups and independents, including a brief period as a participant in the [[Nijisanji]] NetWORK program alongside [[Fairys (vtuber)|]]. Though no longer officially affiliated with the company, he still participates in events such as Nijisanji Koushien. 

His most defining features are his irises shaped like the design on the 1 Pin [[mahjong tile]] and his [[red hair]], [[sunglasses]], [[dice earrings]], and [[track jacket]] emblazoned with the BANs logo. Like Bitou Kaiji, he also has a び ([i]bi[/i])-shaped scar on his cheek.

title: super_sonico
body:
The [[mascot]] character of "NITRO SUPER SONIC", annual live events held by the company [[Nitroplus]]. She made her debut in 2006 and she was designed by [[Tsuji Santa]]. She is the vocalist & guitarist of the band "[i]Daiichi Uchuu Sokudo[/i]" (第一宇宙速度, First Cosmic Velocity) and the other members are bassist [[Fujimi Suzu]] and drummer [[Watanuki Fuuri]].

Sonico is rather shy and clumsy, but nevertheless kind, bubbly, energetic and positive no matter what. Her usual (and most known) outfit consist of a [[casual]] [[blouse]] with a cat printed on it, as well as a [[blue hoodie|blue]] [[hoodie]], and a [[fur-trimmed skirt|fur-trimmed]] [[miniskirt]]. She is never seen without her trademark [[headphones]]. While her physical features depend on the artist, she is consistently depicted with large, [[tareme|droopy]] [[red eyes]], [[pink hair|light pink hair]] and very [[large breasts]].

Her height is 158cm, and her measurements are 90F-57-87. Her birthday is October 14th.

On June 30th, 2018, Sonico "announced":https://twitter.com/sonico_macaron/status/1012578566343573504 her debut as a [[virtual youtuber]], which lasted until January 2020. Her redesign consists of a [[pink jacket|pink]] and [[white jacket|white]] [[letterman jacket]], her trademark cat blouse or a [[camisole]] (depending on what kind of straps are on her shoulders), a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], a pair of [[black legwear thighhighs]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[high heel boots]].

Sonico has a brother figure and male counterpart in [[nitro+ chiral|nitro+CHiRAL]]'s mascot [[Naitou-kun]].
